commitmsg: Another thing to do.
Update README with a list of things that aren't working yet.
Basic implementation of deploy/list/info/teardown commands.
Implement basic "teardown" command.

Hooked up super-basic usage of CloudFormation.

Running `awsboxen deploy` will now push the declared stack into AWS,
but it can't yet create images for the declared boxen so it's pretty
useless.
Fix formatting of usage string.
Add "showconfig" command, to test out config loading.
Make mergeConfig delete keys if incoming value is null
Add loadRootConfig function, for reading .awsboxen file/dir
Implement basic config file loading and merging.
Add automated jshint tests (and some unfinished code)
Fix package.json syntax.
Initial commit.  No working code, mostly just a README.
Add --clear-cached-boxen option to force rebuild of cached AMIs.
Automatically upload ssh key if it's not available.
Bump dev version number
Prepare 0.5.2 release

Update all dependencies to latest available versions.

This involves a few small API changes, and a lot of newly-failing
jshint errors.
Update README to de-emphasize nodejs, clarify current project status.
Bump dev version number.
Release version 0.5.1
Don't error out when listing in a region with no cfn templates.
Add `awsboxen validate` command.
Let BuildScript scripts reference template parameters using {"Ref": "Param"} syntax
Fix stackinfo reporting for ELBs with a single instance.

Don't rebuild AMIs if we know that their contents haven't changed.

For BuildScript based AMIs, this means we only re-build them if the script
itself has changed, not if there have been unrelated changes in the repo.

Let AWSBoxen::BuildScript boxen run multiple build scripts in series.

This makes it a bit easier to share common functionality between different
boxen.  But it's starting to get to the point where puppetizing things may
be easier than not.
Bump to next dev version
Release version 0.5.0

Add "awsboxen info <stack-name> <resource-name>" command.

This is useful for getting more detailed information about a particular stack
resource.  Currently implement is the ability to list all the instances within
an Elastic Load Balancer.
Fix handling of empty --config option

Log individual stack events during deploy/teardown.

This gives a much clearer picture of the progress of your deployment,
as well as better information on any errors that occur.
todos and typos
Remove a now-done item from the todo list
Add command-line option to specify the config file.
Guard against calling Object.keys(null)

Tweak handing of null during config merge.

Previously it would result in keys being deleted. Now we leave
the null in place, and expect calling code to deal with it gracefully.
This helps some corner-cases when merging sibling config files.
Add another idea to the TODO list
Correct parsing of -D options when -F is not specified
Fix deployment to use opts.stack_name, not opts.name
Don't create bogus empty keys when merging sibling configs
Add another todo
Document parameter-file loading in the README
Implement loading of parameters from (optionally encrypted) json files.
Refactor option-gathering logic into a separate submodule
Add missing test config file
Cleanups and tests for param resolution in boxen defns
Bump dev version number
Prep version 0.4.0

Remove the  "UserDataFiles" helper function.

It turns out that CloudFormation::Init metadata offers broadly similar
functionality, so there's no point duplicating it ourselves.

Resolve some uses of {Ref} and {Fn::FindInMap} inside Boxen decls.

This is required if you want to e.g. use a different base AMI depending
on the target region.  It's nice to use the same syntax as CloudFormation
runtime.

Rename "projinfo.js" to "loadTemplate.js".

That's the only thing it actually does these days.
Allow setting of AWS creds and region on the command line.
Add some comments on UserDataFiles to the readme
Update TODOs based on latest development.
Bump dev version number

Implement "Fn::AWSBoxen::UserDataFiles" pre-processing function.

This function is very helpful for writing config files at instance
startup, by means of a UserData script.  The implementation could use
a serious refactor, but it's a start.
Tweak how .awsbox.json decls are turned into boxen decls.
Release version 0.3.0

Assign snapshot names to match the name of their owning AMI.

This should make it a bit easier to clean up snapshots that are no
longer in use.

Refuse to deploy if there are uncommitted changes to the repo.

The new --ignore-uncommitted flag will override this, but it's off by
default since uncommitted changes will not get propertly deployed.
Add changelog

Read top-level "awsboxen.json" file in addition to ".awsboxen.json".

I find this to be cleaner when your repo as lots of additional build stuff,
like AWSBoxen::BuildScript scripts.
Allow '-D key=value' syntax to define template parameter values.
Bump version to 0.2.1
Fix potential null-deference bug.

Allow awsboxen config files to declare version dependencies.

The top-level key AWSBoxenVersion can be set to a semver version range,
and awsboxen will refuse to deploy if its current version does not
satisfy that range.
Bump to version 0.1.2
Add a --version command-line option
Update examples in README to better match actual output.
Bump to version 0.1.1
Fix accidental attempt to use "+" in AMI names.
Update to latest awsbox dependency
Add a TODO to the README

Commit overwritten .awsbox.json files.

If they're not committed, the awsboxen freezer won't use them properly.
Successfully convince the buildscript to run as root
Dont use sudo for buildscript, it doesn't work reliably when tunnelled

Remove "awsboxen" prefix from AWS resource names.

They're just getting too long otherwise!

Tweak how profile overrides are processed, and add testcase for it.

These tweaks make it easier for profiles to override part of the default
.awsbox.json configuration while leaving other parts of intact.
Use sudo to execute the build script.

Allow boxen to be built with a simple build script.

This allows you to include instances that are not built via awsbox,
e.g. a mysql or cassandra storage node.

Merge pull request #5 from chilts/fix-package-dependencies-for-awssum

Fix dependencies for awssum-amazon-* packages

Fix dependencies for awssum-amazon-* packages

Since AwsSum has a plugin architecture, each plugin depends on awssum
itself. Using the new peerDependencies each package pulls in awssum
alongside itself. Also, each awssum-<provider>-<service> package also
pulls in the relevant awssum-<provider> package too.

Finally, using semver, it pays to depend on the v1.0.x patch series,
rather than sticking with a fixed version number.
Tweaking package meta-data for initial release

Make each top-level 'command' function return something useful.

This might be helpful for other scripts that want to call awsboxen
without shelling out and parsing its console output.
Expand lint tests to check for MPL license header.
Add MPL license headers, cleanup some comments.
Update to awsbox 0.4.4, which lets the app start automatically on boot.
Tag deployed stacks with their profile name and git commit hash.
Add workaround to start nodejs app on boot.
Another idea recorded in TODO section
Add a couple of TODO items
Fix typo in comment
Re-order commands in help string and README
Tweak README to better match current state of code.

Include CFN Output values in output from "info" command.

This provides an easy way to get at e.g. the public loadbalancer URL.
Tweak README to better match state of code.
Fix teardown of awsbox freezer instances.
Rename "DefaultBox" to "AWSBox"
Tweak README
Tweak polling interval
Tweaks for pushing non-HEAD commits into the awsbox

Abandon the idea of passing git refs to awsboxen.

This would substantially complicate things.  If you want to deploy a
specific version, check it out before running the command.
Expore awsbox deploy key as a CFN template parameter
Fix workingDir for 'git checkout' command.
Add more default resources, trying to match what awsbox spins up.
Make Boxen AMIs referencable as template parameters.
Give frozen AMIs predictable unique names, and avoid rebuilding if already present
Finer control over "awsbox freeze" command.

Add basic AMI freezing via awsbox.

This also adds a "freeze" command that can be used to generate just
the AMI, rather than doing a full deployment.
Tweak README to better match actual state of code.

More complete setting of defaults when loading the config.

This now sets up default Boxen and Resource definitions if none are specified,
and can load data from .awsbox.json in addition to .awsboxen.json.  In theory
this will make it capable of deploying an unmodified awsbox-enabled repo.
Code cleanups and comments.
Add --clear-cached-boxen option to force rebuild of cached AMIs.
Automatically upload ssh key if it's not available.
Bump dev version number
Prepare 0.5.2 release

Update all dependencies to latest available versions.

This involves a few small API changes, and a lot of newly-failing
